meanings.definition: To have in or be able to bring to one's mind an awareness of (someone or something from the past)
meanings.sent1: I remembered my friend's birthday and sent her a card.
meanings.sent2: She remembered the lyrics to her favorite song.
meanings.sent3: He remembered to bring an umbrella on a sunny day, just in case.
meanings.sent4: The old photograph remembered a time long gone.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh cookies baking in the oven remembered her of her childhood home.

meanings.sent1: The story was so interesting that I remembered every detail.
meanings.sent2: Even after many years, she remembered the lessons her grandmother taught her.
meanings.sent3: He remembered the password after writing it down on a sticky note.
meanings.sent4: The melody of the song remembered in his mind long after it ended.
meanings.sent5: The smell of the ocean breeze remembered him of his summer vacations as a child.

meanings.definition: To keep in mind for attention or consideration
meanings.sent1: I remembered to buy milk on my way home.
meanings.sent2: She remembered to call her friend on her birthday.
meanings.sent3: He remembered to water the plants after seeing them wilting.
meanings.sent4: The promise he made to his grandmother was always remembered.
meanings.sent5: The warning sign on the road remembered drivers to slow down in the curve.
